snippet: Government efforts to suppress a local revolt have taken a fearful and deadly turn with the indiscriminate use of long-range rockets, witnesses say.
abstract: Sudanese Army has begun using long-range rockets to bombard the Nuba Mountains in its increasingly ruthless attempt to suppress an insurgency; witnesses say the rockets have often fallen in villages, killing civilians, rather than legitimate military targets; analysts have established that the rockets are manufactured in China, one of Sudan's closest strategic allies.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Khartoum, Sudan.

lead_paragraph: Government efforts to suppress a local revolt have taken a fearful and deadly turn with the indiscriminate use of long-range rockets, witnesses say.

headline.seo: In Sudan’s Nuba Mountains, Rocket Attacks Spread Fear
headline.main: In Sudan’s Nuba Mountains, Government Rocket Attacks Sow Fear, Witnesses Say
headline.print_headline: In Sudan’s Nuba Mountains, Government Rocket Attacks Sow Fear, Witnesses Say
